tasks.title: What is User Experience (UX) Design?
tasks.description: Learn the basics of UX Design.

Quizzes.Question: What do you understand by the term 'User Experience'?
Options: Option 1 - It is about designing the look of the product.
Option 2 - It involves the overall experience of the user interacting with the product.
Option 3 - It focuses solely on user interface design.

Quizzes.Question: Which of the following is NOT a key principle of UX Design?

tasks.title: Historical Overview of UX Design
tasks.description: Explore the history of UX Design.

Quizzes.Question: Who is considered one of the pioneers of UX Design?
In which decade did the term 'User Experience' become popular?

tasks.title: Understanding User-Centered Design
tasks.description: Understand the key principles of user-centered design.

Quizzes.Question: What is the primary focus of user-centered design?
Options: Option 2 - Meeting user needs and preferences

Quizzes.Question: Which method is commonly used in user-centered design?

tasks.title: The Role of UX Design in Digital Products
tasks.description: Understand how UX design applies to digital products.

Quizzes.Question: What is a key benefit of UX design in digital products?
Which of the following best describes UX design?
Options: Option 1 - Designing for user interaction and satisfaction

tasks.title: Introduction to UX Design Tools and Techniques
tasks.description: Learn about the tools and techniques used in UX Design.

Quizzes.Question: Which tool is commonly used for wireframing in UX design?
What is the purpose of user personas in UX design?
Options: Option 1 - To represent target users and their needs
Option 2 - To define design color schemes

tasks.title: Introduction to the Elements of UX
tasks.description: Learn about the different elements of user experience.

Quizzes.Question: Which element is NOT typically considered a part of UX?
What does 'usability' refer to in UX design?
Options: Option 1 - How easy and efficient a product is to use
Option 3 - The cost of the product

Quizzes.Question: Which principle focuses on the arrangement of elements to guide user attention?
What is the role of 'white space' in visual design?
Options: Option 1 - To create breathing room and improve readability
Option 3 - To increase the text density
